results:
Based on my search results, I found information about doctoral dissertations on "The Great Gatsby" at Polish universities:

A doctoral dissertation was written at the Pedagogical University of the National Education Commission in Krakow, Faculty of Humanities, under the supervision of prof. dr hab. Aleksandra Budrewicz, with assistant supervisor prof. dr hab. Agnieszka Gicala.(no content)This dissertation discusses selected linguistic elements of Polish translations of F. Scott Fitzgerald's novel "The Great Gatsby." The title of the dissertation is "Dominanta semantyczna w polskich przekładach powieści Francisa Scotta Fitzgeralda Wielki Gatsby" (Semantic Dominant in Polish Translations of Francis Scott Fitzgerald's Novel The Great Gatsby).

The dissertation examines the semantic dominant of "The Great Gatsby," discussing selected elements including Fitzgerald's characteristic use of colors, non-standard language varieties of the novel's characters, the allusiveness and symbolism of the text, the presence of autobiographical elements, and references to the social and cultural life of the 1920s.(no content)The analysis uses Stanisław Barańczak's concept of semantic dominant, and the author concluded that most of the selected elements were translated by all translators in accordance with the assumptions of the semantic dominant of the original.

The dissertation was completed on September 30, 2021 and is available in the repository of the Pedagogical University in Krakow.

This appears to be a comprehensive doctoral work focusing on translation studies and American literature, specifically examining how Polish translators have approached Fitzgerald's masterpiece while maintaining its semantic integrity and cultural significance.
